reasoning: Reporting incidence of new Alzheimer's diagnoses. Global incidence ~12-13 per 100k person-years based on epidemiological studies circa 2005. Varies by age group with dramatic increase after age 65.
source: Ferri CP et al. (2005). Global prevalence of dementia: a Delphi consensus study. Lancet. 366(9503):2112-2117
